sen.j: 黒川 道祐（くろかわ どうゆう、生年不詳 - 1691年（元禄4年））は、江戸時代初期の医者であり、歴史家である。
sen.e: Doyu KUROKAWA (year of birth unknown - 1691) was a doctor and historian who lived during the early Edo period.

sen.j: 主著として医学史書の『本朝医考』と、山城国の地誌である『雍州府志』（岩波文庫で上のみ）がある。
sen.e: He authored a book of the history of medical science called "Honcho Iko" (The Medicine of This Realm) and a geographical description of Yamashiro Province called "Yoshufushi" (only the first volume is available from the Iwanami Library).

sen.j: 道祐は字であり、名は玄逸、号に静庵、遠碧軒などがある。
sen.e: Doyu was his azana (nickname), and his first name was Genistu, and also, he had some go (pseudonyms) such as Seian and Enpekiken.

sen.e: After he resigned from that post, he lived in Kyoto and established a friendship with Ekiken KAIBARA, who was a specialist of herbalism.

sen.j: 河窪武田家（清和源氏を祖とする）の武田信成（江戸期の医師）の娘を嫁として迎え入れ、その長男信郷（叔安）が河窪武田家を継ぐ。
sen.e: He married a daughter of Nobunari TAKEDA (a doctor who lived during the Edo period), who was from the Kawakubo Takeda family (this family was originated from Seiwa-Genji [Minamoto clan]), and their eldest son Nobusato (also known as Shukuan) succeeded to the head of the Kawakubo Takeda family.

sen.e: Yusuke KUROKAWA, the 13th head of the Kurokawa family, has experienced some posts such as the executive vice president of Tanashin Denki Co., Ltd. and a board member of Takakita Co., Ltd.
